alert.note: Alert for Hunt; Rockwall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 24 at 1:46PM CST until December 25 at 7:42AM CST by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... South Fork Sabine River Near Quinlan affecting Rockwall and Hunt Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Fork Sabine River near Quinlan. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Minor out of bank flooding will occur. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:45 PM CST Sunday the stage was 14.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late this afternoon to 15.2 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage this evening to 4.3 feet early Tuesday afternoon. It will rise to 5.3 feet early Wednesday morning. It will then fall to 4.7 feet early Thursday morning. It will rise to 4.9 feet Thursday evening. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/fwd.
